model

Class BattleshipModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.BattleshipModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class BattleshipModel
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.io.Serializable
    Model of the Battleship boardgame simulator. It holds a Player, a Computer, the size of the game grid, the timer (if the match is timed) and the file name of the ".dat" file to save/load.
    Author:
    20027017 & 20031485
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • BattleshipModel

        public BattleshipModel()
        Default constructor for the class BattleshipModel.

      • BattleshipModel

        public BattleshipModel(int gameSize)
        Constructor for the class BattleshipModel, which initializes a default instance of BattleshipModel from the game size it receives as parameter.
        Parameters:
        gameSize - The game size of the current Battleship match.

      • BattleshipModel

        public BattleshipModel(Player player,
                       Computer computer,
                       int gameSize,
                       boolean timed,
                       int secs)
        Constructor for the class BattleshipModel. It initializes all of its main parameters such as Player, Computer and the game size, essential for a simple Battleship match.
        Parameters:
        player - A Player instance.
        computer - A Computer instance.
        gameSize - The size of the current Battleship match.
        timed - A boolean value, true if the BattleshipModel has to be timed.
        secs - The number of seconds the timer has to be initialized with.

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame()
        Saves the current BattleshipModel object and all its content into a ".dat" binary file.

      • newGame

        public void newGame(Player player,
                    Computer computer,
                    int gameSize,
                    boolean timed,
                    int secs)
        Initialize a BattleshipModel with all of its necessary parameters.
        Parameters:
        player - A Player instance.
        computer - A Computer instance.
        gameSize - The size of the current Battleship match.
        timed - A boolean value, true if the match is timed, false otherwise.
        secs - The number of seconds the timer will be initialized with.

      • loadGame

        public static BattleshipModel loadGame()
                                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Static method that checks if a ".dat" binary file is present and tries to load its content into a BattleshipModel object. On failure, a FileNotFoundException is thrown.
        Returns:
        The BattleshipModel object loaded from binary file.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • setTimed

        public void setTimed(boolean timed,
                     int secs)
        Sets the timer of a BattleshipModel object. If timed is false, the secs parameter is ignored.
        Parameters:
        timed - A boolean value: true if the game is timed, false otherwise.
        secs - The number of seconds assigned to the timer (if enabled).

      • getSecs

      • turns

        public void turns()
        Prototype of BattleshipModel's terminal version. It simulates the interaction between Player and Computer until either of them is defeated.

      • hitAndGetHit

        public void hitAndGetHit(int row,
                         int col)
        This method simulates a couple of turns (Player's and Computer's in order) in which each of the players hits the other once. The parameters are the coordinates of the cell the Player wants to hit on the Computer's grid.
        Parameters:
        row - The row coordinate of the cell the Player wants to hit.
        col - The column coordinate of the cell the Player wants to hit.

      • playerSetsShips

        public void playerSetsShips()
        Prototype of BattleshipModel's terminal version. It simulates the Player's positioning of its Ships.

      • playerSetsShip

        public void playerSetsShip(int shipIndex,
                           int row,
                           int col,
                           ShipDirection direction)
        Place one of the available Player's Ships on its ships grid.
        Parameters:
        shipIndex - The index of the Ship in the Player's ships list.
        row - The row coordinate where the Player wants to place its Ship.
        col - The column coordinate where the Player wants to place its Ship.
        direction - The ShipDirection of the Ship being set.

      • print

        public void print()
        Utility method to speed up the usage of the toString() method.
